Documentary Fictions: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Undergraduate Film & Television Admissions About the Program Course Offerings Summer Courses Showcase Internships Facilities Special Projects First Run & Festivals Calendar of Events News TSOA FTV Wiki Admin & Faculty Alumni Blog Facebook Twitter YouTube  home > Undergraduate Film & TV        Documentary Fictions  H56.1207 Lecture 3 Credits This course will explore the blurred boundaries between documentary and fiction filmmaking which have always been there from the very birth of cinema and are a major conceptual force in the cutting edge films of today. Intended to widen the horizons of the creative filmmaker, we will analyze documentary traditions with a specific focus on the narrative techniques used in the telling of powerful stories. Alongside, we will examine contemporary fiction films that have broken new grounds by a creative absorption and sometimes exploitation of the documentary method. These include films that deliberately confound fact and fiction, include improvisations, dramatic reconstructions and are occasionally downright mock-docs. We will examine the "truth claims" and "reality principles" of a wide-ranging, eclectic body of international cinema, both fiction and documentary, and in doing so, will recast the definition of 'documentary' today.
